text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm and remember that leftover breast
fed beef we had the top round i said i
was going to make something with it this
is what i made so i had i don't know it
was like a pound piece from the end of
the top round ooh it had a little extra
connective tissue we decided not to use
it for our London broil so what I like
to do when I have kind of odd leftover
hunks of meat is I'm going to dice this
up in like half inch quarter inch dice
just cut it in strips and then cut
across and what we're going to do is
we're going to make a really simple meat
sauce alright so a lot of you make
similar recipes but use ground beef and
I think it's really nice sometimes to
use actual pieces of meat so in a saute
pan on medium high heat and a good glug
of olive oil I'm going to put in my
chopped top round and we're going to
brown that really well all right this is
not in real time by any means this was
like 15 minutes of browning when it got
nice and browned and there was a nice
fond at the bottom of the pan that
cooked on caramelized meat juice I threw
in some garlic and some green onions by
the way this is ultra simple like I just
want to cook dinner I don't care if it's
a recipe or not type recipe so in goes
the onions and the garlic saute those
for 2 minutes to soften I'm going to add
about 1/2 a cup of ideally beef stock
but I didn't have beef stock so I used
water which is totally fine because you
see how much caramelization was on the
bottom of the pan and that Fond
dissolves and it makes a really rich
broth alright I'm going to add some milk
or cream cream will be a little richer
milk you probably have in your
refrigerator already alright and when
that comes back to a simmer I'm going to
add one jar of prepared pasta sauce I'm
using Barilla just a regular marinara
and we're going to simmer that for as
long as it takes for that meat to get
really deliciously tender which I don't
know how long that took
I probably simmer this for about 40
minutes 45 minutes I think you can add
water here and there along the way to
keep the consistency the thickness that
you like especially when you're using a
big pan like this
it can evaporate pretty quickly so i'ma
leave this on medium heat simmer that
till tender of course I'm going to
season generously with salt and pepper
and pepper flakes all right I'm going to
put a big pinch of dried Italian herbs
and we're just going to let that cook
and meld together and it's going to be
fantastic
all right so about 4045 minutes later I
was thinking you know this is looking
like it's getting close to being done so
I tasted it delicious the meat very
tender and succulent top round often
used in hamburger mixtures because it is
very flavorful so it does make a really
nice meat sauce of course if you need to
adjust this is where you do it a little
more salt a little more pepper i boiled
some penne I tossed it with the sauce a
little cheese on top and if you've never
tried a meat sauce with chopped meat
instead of ground you should try it go
to the site get all the ingredients and
as always enjoy
